item.title: [LLOYDSME] Thriveni Earthmovers Pvt Ltd Releases Pledge on Lloyds Metals and Energy Shares
item.description:
Thriveni Earthmovers Pvt Ltd (TEMPL), a promoter of Lloyds Metals and Energy Limited (Target Company), has released a pledge on 64,14,150 (1.18% of the paid-up share capital of the TC) equity shares of the TC held by TEMPL, in favour of ICICI Bank Limited. This unattested pledge agreement was executed on 29th May, 2024.

  • Thriveni Earthmovers Pvt Ltd, a promoter of Lloyds Metals and Energy Limited, has released a pledge on 1.18% of the company's shares.
  • The pledge was in favour of ICICI Bank Limited as per an Unattested Pledge Agreement dated 29th May, 2024.
  • 64,14,150 equity shares of Lloyds Metals and Energy Limited were affected by this pledge release.
  • The pledge was released on 19th February, 2026.

item.title: [DHINDIA] Prominent Dilution of Voting Rights in D & H India Ltd by Harsh Vora and Others
item.description:
ðŸ”¥ Trending

According to a disclosure made under Regulation 29(2) of SEBI (Substantial Acquisition of Shares & Takeovers) Regulations, 2011, there has been a significant dilution of voting rights in D & H India Ltd due to non-subscription of Rights Entitlement by the Promoter and Persons Acting in Concert (PAC). The notable changes in shareholding are as follows: Harsh Vora's holding has decreased from 13.43% to 10.74%, Harsh Kumar Vora (HUF)'s holding has decreased from 8.23% to 6.58%, Saurabh Vora's holding has decreased from 17.11% to 16.50%, and Kiran Vora, Atithi Vora, and Suhani Doshi's holdings have decreased from 11.50%, 0.61%, and 0.61% to 2.30%, 1.20%, and 1.20% respectively. The total dilution in shareholding for the Promoter and PAC is 10.30%. This change exceeds 2% of the total voting rights of the Promoter and Promoter Group of the Company.

item.title: [FLAIR] Flair Writing Industries Limited Commences Manufacturing of Wooden Pencils; Strengthens Creative Portfolio
item.description:
ðŸ”¥ Trending

Flair Writing Industries Limited has started manufacturing wooden pencils at its step down subsidiary, Flomaxe Stationery Private Limited in Surat. This expansion strengthens the company's Creative portfolio and enhances its abilities to penetrate further into the largest segment of the stationery industry. The production line will have an estimated annual capacity of 84 Million pieces and will also focus on manufacturing of complimentary products such as range of erasers and sharpeners. This move is a part of the company's strategy to rapidly scale the creative segment which grew by 72% year on year in 9M FY26.

  • Flair Writing Industries Limited has begun manufacturing wooden pencils at Flomaxe Stationery Private Limited in Surat.
  • The new manufacturing line has an estimated annual capacity of 84 Million pieces.
  • The company will also focus on manufacturing of complimentary products such as range of erasers and sharpeners.
  • This expansion strengthens the company's Creative portfolio and enhances its abilities to penetrate further into the largest segment of the stationery industry.

item.title: [ORGANICREC] Organic Recycling Systems Secures Large-Scale EPC Contract for CBG Project in Madhya Pradesh
item.description:
ðŸ”¥ Trending

Organic Recycling Systems (ORSL) has secured a large-scale order from Shreyam Manek Agro Products Pvt. Ltd. for the construction of a state-of-the-art Integrated Compressed Bio-Gas (CBG) and biofertilizer project in Damoh, Madhya Pradesh. The facility is designed to produce an output of 10 TPD (Tons Per Day) of CBG using agro feedstock. ORSL will undertake equity participation, end-to-end EPC execution, encompassing detailed engineering, technology integration, supply of critical equipment, construction, installation, and commissioning of the facility. The project reflects a strategic collaboration and is part of a larger plan of 10 (ten) such integrated projects to be deployed in various locations of Madhya Pradesh with a total outlay of 500-600 Cr INR within a period of 3 years.

  • ORSL secures a large-scale EPC contract for a CBG project in Madhya Pradesh
  • The project is designed to produce 10 TPD of CBG using agro feedstock
  • ORSL will undertake equity participation and end-to-end EPC execution
  • The project is part of a larger plan of 10 integrated projects in Madhya Pradesh
  • The total outlay of the projects is 500-600 Cr INR within a period of 3 years
